data.scheme_name: Uttar Pradesh Warehousing and Logistics Policy 2022 - Cargo Terminals - Capital Subsidy - New
data.benefits: Scheme provides Capital Subsidy at the rate of 20% on the Eligible Capital Investment for the development of such terminals, subject to maximum Rs.1500 lakhs.
data.eligibility: All new units who wants to setup Cargo Terminal project are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions: Eligible Cargo Terminal project means greenfield Cargo Terminal developed as common user facility (not captive use) in the State over minimum 10 acres of land area with minimum capital investment (except land cost) of Rs.2000 lakhs.EIP (Eligibility Investment Period) starts from the first investment date within the effective period and lasts up to 5 years or until commercial operations begin, whichever is earlier.Eligible Capital Investment refers to capital investment made during the eligible investment period. If investment starts before the effective date, at least 80% must be made after the effective date for it to be considered eligible for incentives.
data.beneficiaries: All new units who wants to setup Cargo Terminal project are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites: Eligible Cargo Terminal project means greenfield Cargo Terminal developed as common user facility (not captive use) in the State over minimum 10 acres of land area with minimum capital investment (except land cost) of Rs.2000 lakhs.EIP (Eligibility Investment Period) starts from the first investment date within the effective period and lasts up to 5 years or until commercial operations begin, whichever is earlier.Eligible Capital Investment refers to capital investment made during the eligible investment period. If investment starts before the effective date, at least 80% must be made after the effective date for it to be considered eligible for incentives.
data.nodal_agency: Uttar Pradesh State Industrial Development Authority (UPSIDA)
data.context: Logistics is crucial in the global economy as it facilitates the exchange of goods and services for money through trade. This industry not only fosters economic growth but also addresses environmental and social concerns.
data.objective: The UP Government aims to enhance warehousing and logistics infrastructure, encourage private investment, create jobs, and adopt smart logistics methods through a new policy.
data.description: Scheme provides Capital Subsidy at the rate of 20% on the Eligible Capital Investment for the development of such terminals, subject to maximum Rs.1500 lakhs.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can register themselves to the given following link: https://niveshmitra.up.nic.in/Default.aspx
data.funding_facilitator: Uttar Pradesh State Industrial Development Authority (UPSIDA)
data.funding_mechanism: The subsidy shall be disbursed in 3 annual instalments post completion of the project.
data.checklist_info_a:
Project Proposal/Business Plan
Proof of Land Ownership or Lease Agreement
Company Registration Documents
PAN Card and GST Registration
Bank Guarantee (if required for exemptions)
Environmental Clearance (if applicable)
Affidavit or Undertaking for Project Commitment
Financial Statements (Balance Sheets, Profit & Loss)
Proof of Eligibility for Incentives (e.g., investment details)
Proof of Compliance with Local Authority Regulations
Approvals from Industrial/Development Authorities (if applicable)
data.checklist_info_d:
